CNIdOm ( FIg. 14 ): BASITRIChS, b -mASTIgOphOReS, hOlOTRIChS, p -mASTIgOphOReS A ANd B2A, p -mASTIgOphOReS A WITh lOOped bASAl TUbUle, ANd SpIROCYSTS. See TAble 6 fOR SIZe ANd dISTRIbUTION.

Geographic and bathymetric distribution.
Isoaulactinia hespervolita
IS fOUNd ONlY IN The INTeRTIdAl IN The MeXICAN PACIfIC IN PUNTA AbReOjOS, VIZCAINO BAY ANd PUeRTO PeñASCO ( DAlY 2004 ). ThIS IS The fIRST TIme RepORTed IN TeCOlOTe, LA PAZ BAY, IN The INTeRTIdAl (beTWeeN 0–1 meTeRS).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 12. External anatomy of
Isoaulactinia hespervolita Daly, 2004
. A) Lateral view of preserved specimen. B–C) Detail of pseudoacrorhagi with and without nipple-like structure, respectively. D–E) Oral view of living specimen showing marked and unmarked tentacles. F) Detail of tentacles showing a bifurcate tip. Bifurcation (B), Margin (Ma), Nipple-like structure (N), Oral disc (Od), Pseudoacrorhagi (P), Verrucae (Ve). Scale bars: 5 mm.

FIGURE 13. Internal anatomy of
Isoaulactinia hespervolita Daly, 2004
. A) Longitudinal section of the distal column. B) Cross section of the column at the level of the actinopharynx showing the cycles of mesenteries (cycles marked by numbers). C) Cross section through a tentacle showing ectodermal longitudinal musculature. D) Detail of a longitudinal section of the column showing pseudoacrorhagi. E) Detail of a cross section of the column at the level of the actinopharynx showing the retractor and parietobasilar muscles. F) Cross section of column showing gametogenic tissue. G) Longitudinal section of proximal end showing basilar muscles. Basilar muscles (Ba), Ectoderm (Ec), Endoderm (En), Fosse (Fo), Mesoglea (Me), Parietobasilar muscles (Pa), Pseudoacrorhagi (P), Retractor muscles (Re), Spermatic cysts (Sc), Sphincter (Sp), Verrucae (Ve), Tentacle (Te). Scale bars: A, C–G, 0.1 mm; B, 0.5 mm.

. N, Total number of capsules measured; M, Ratio of number o specimens in which each cnida was found to number of specimens examined. Sizes in micrometers. caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 14. Cnidae of
Isoaulactinia hespervolita Daly, 2004
. A, B, D, F, G, H, L, M, O, P) Basitrichs. I) Holotrich. J) p - mastigophore A with looped basal tubule. Q) b -mastigophore. E, K, N, R) p -mastigophores A. S) p -mastigophore B2a. C) Spirocyst.

(2018) IN TheIR INTeRpReTATION ThAT NemATOCYSTS WITh lOOped OR UNdUlATINg ShAfTS ARe ImmATURe STAgeS WhOSe CApSUleS beCOme STRAIghTeR ANd WhOSe ShAfT beCOmeS ShORTeR AS The helICeS TIghTeN, eSpeCIAllY IN The pROXImAl RegION, WITh A VISIble CeNTRAl ROd-ShAped STRUCTURe ON The pROXImAl ShAfT ANd lATeR WIThOUT IT (See ÖSTmAN et al. 2010A, 2010b ANd dISCUSSION IN GUSmãO et al . 2018). I. hespervolita

NeVeRTheleSS, beCAUSe A ThOROUgh STUdY ON TheSe ISSUeS hAS ONlY beeN dONe WIThIN meTRIdIOIdeANS ANd p -mASTIgOphOReS B (ÖSTmAN et al . 2010b), We pRefeR TO kepT The AbOVe CATegORIeS Of NemATOCYSTS SepARATe IN ThIS CONTRIbUTION UNTIl bOTh SpeCIeS Of The geNUS ARe SpeCIfICAllY ReVISed ON ThIS ISSUe. bY DAlY (2004) .
